title: A/L exams suspended for two days due to adverse weather
byline: The 2025 GCE Advanced Level Examination scheduled for today (27) and tomorrow (28) will not be held as scheduled, the Commissioner General of Examinations, AKS Indika Kumari Liyanage has announced.

title: Death toll in Hong Kong fire rises to 44 with 279 still missing, authorities say
byline: At least 44 people have been killed in a major fire engulfing apartment blocks in the Tai Po district of Hong Kong, with 279 people not accounted for.

title: Major flood warning issued to residents of low-lying areas of Deduru Oya Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued major flood warning for residents of low-lying areas along Deduru Oya Basin.

title: Court orders Daisy Forrest to undergo psychiatric examination
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that a psychiatric medical report be obtained to determine whether Daisy Forrest, the grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, is in a suitable mental condition to appear for court proceedings.

title: Very heavy rains above 200 mm are likely in some areas today
byline: Very heavy falls above 200 mm are likely at some places in North-central, North-western provinces and in Trincomalee district and above 150mm are likely at some places in North, Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva, Western provinces and in Galle, Matara and Batticaloa districts.

title: Trains services affected due to adverse weather
byline: Train services along the upcountry and coastal lines have been affected owing to adverse weather conditions.

title: Level 3 (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in four districts
byline: A ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning has been issued for multiple areas in the Badulla, Kandy, Matale and Nuwara Eliya districts by the National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO).

title: Four persons missing following two landslides in Udadumbara and Pathahewaheta
byline: Four persons reported missing from two locations following landslides in Udadumbara and Pathahewaheta in Kandy.

title: Two National Guard members in critical condition after shooting near White House
byline: Two National Guard soldiers are critically injured after being gunned down in Washington DC, less than two blocks from the White House, in what the city’s mayor called a “targeted shooting”.

title: Very heavy rains above 200 mm likely in some areas today
byline: The low-pressure area southeast of Sri Lanka has intensified into a depression and is about 210km southeast of Batticaloa, the Department of Meteorology has announced.

title: Section of Bentota old bridge collapses due to adverse weather conditions
byline: The right section of the Bentota Old Bridge, which had been closed to the public, reportedly collapsed last night (26) amid prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Batticaloa-Polonnaruwa main road closed for traffic in Manampitiya
byline: The Batticaloa-Polonnaruwa main road is completely closed for traffic in Manampitiya after the area is submerged following heavy rains, police stated.

title: Badulla landslide death toll increases to 11, seven missing
byline: The death toll from earthslips and landslides occurred in seven locations in the Badulla District owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, has risen to 11.

title: Peru sentences ex-President Vizcarra to 14 years in prison for corruption
byline: A Peruvian court on Wednesday sentenced former President Martin Vizcarra to 14 years in prison after finding him guilty of taking bribes years before he took office, adding to a list of former leaders jailed for corruption.

title: Four dead, nine missing due to landslides reported in Badulla
byline: At least four people have died in six landslide incidents reported in the Badulla District.

title: Train operations affected due to adverse weather
byline: Train operations along the main, coastal and Kelani Valley railway lines have been disrupted as a result of fallen trees obstructing the tracks, Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Firearm in possession of ex-MP Uditha Lokubandara during Nugegoda rally taken into police custody
byline: A pistol which was in possession of former MP Uditha Lokubandara during the joint opposition rally at Nugegoda on 21 November has been taken into police custody.

title: President to chair special meeting to discuss current disaster situation
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to chair a special meeting within the Parliament complex to discuss the prevailing disaster situation in the country.

title: Four dead following landslide in Walapane
byline: At least four individuals have died following a landslide reported in Walapane, Nuwara Eliya, the Disaster Management Centre said.

title: Parliament Select Committee appointed to probe release of 323 containers without mandatory inspection
byline: A Parliamentary Select Committee has been appointed to investigate the release of 323 containers from the Colombo Harbour without subject to mandatory customs inspection.

title: Eight spill gates of Deduru Oya reservoir opened
byline: Eight spill gates of the Deduru Oya reservoir have been opened due to heavy rainfall in catchment areas, the Department of Irrigation has announced.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather in recent days climbs to 31
byline: The number of deaths reported owing to adverse weather conditions across the country since November 17 has increased to 31, the Disaster Management Centre said.

title: Kandy-Mahiyanganaya main road closed for traffic from Medamahanuwara to Hasalaka
byline: The Kandy-Mahiyanganaya main road has been temporarily closed for vehicular traffic between Medamahanuwara and Hasalaka until further notice, the Kandy District Secretary has announced.

title: A/L exams suspended for three days, alternative dates announced
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination scheduled for today (27), tomorrow (28) and on Saturday (29) will not be held as scheduled, the Commissioner General of Examinations, AKS Indika Kumari Liyanage has announced.

title: Section of boundary wall of Vidyartha College stadium collapses
byline: A section of the boundary wall of the Vidyartha College stadium in Kandy has reportedly collapsed last night (26).

title: Level 3 landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in 7 districts
byline: A ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning has been issued for multiple areas in the 7 districts by the National Building and Research Organisation.

title: No risk of tsunami following earthquake in Sumatra
byline: There is no risk of tsunami following a 6.6 magnitude earthquake which struck off the Indonesian island of Sumatra this morning, the Department of Meteorology has announced.

title: Train services on upcountry line further impacted due to adverse weather conditions
byline: Train services along the upcountry line have been restricted owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the Department of Railways said.

title: Announcement from DMT on driving licence issuance
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic has announced that the online driving license issuance services at the main office in Werahera and district offices have been temporarily suspended.

title: Alibaba starts selling Quark AI glasses in China, enters global wearables race
byline: Alibaba released on Thursday its new Quark artificial intelligence glasses in China, heralding the Chinese tech company’s efforts to break into the AI wearables market dominated by Meta globally.

title: Special party leaders’ meeting called to decide on Parliament sittings
byline: A special party leaders’ meeting has been called to decide on the conduct of Parliament sittings in the upcoming days, Minister Samantha Viddyarathna said.

title: All Muslim schools closed today and tomorrow amid adverse weather conditions
byline: Muslim schools across the country will remain closed today (27) and tomorrow (28), owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: Earthquake of 6.6 magnitude strikes off Indonesia’s Sumatra, Sri Lankans residing in coastal areas urged to be vigilant
byline: A powerful earthquake of 6.6 magnitude struck off the Indonesian island of Sumatra at around 10:26 a.m., the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) said.

title: Train hits China railway workers, killing 11
byline: A train ran into a group of railway workers on Thursday (Nov 27), killing 11 and injuring two, officials in China’s southwestern city of Kunming said, the deadliest rail accident in more than a decade.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather increases to 39
byline: The number of deaths reported owing to adverse weather conditions across the country in the past few hours has increased to 39, the Disaster Management Centre noted.

title: Three killed after car falls into canal in Sainthamaruthu
byline: Three people traveling in a motor vehicle have died after the vehicle fell into a canal flowing near Bolivia village in Sainthamaruthu, Ampara.

title: ‘Red’ Alert: Deep Depression near Sri Lanka likely to intensify into Cyclone
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ alert warning for the land and the sea areas around the island due to the deep depression over south-east of Sri Lanka.

title: DMC requests public to report all disaster related incidents via 117 hotline
byline: The Disaster Management Centre requests the general public to report any emergency situations arising due to the adverse weather conditions by calling the 117 hotline.

title: Several train journeys to Batticaloa and Trincomalee cancelled until further notice
byline: The Railway Department has decided to cancel six long-distance, intercity and night mail train journeys that were scheduled to run on the Batticaloa and Trincomalee lines today (27).

title: 5,700 individuals living with HIV in Sri Lanka, infections decline globally
byline: HIV infections in Sri Lanka have increased despite a decline in cases globally, according to data released by the National STD/AIDS Control Programme.

title: Heavy rains trigger major flood alert in Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a warning of a potential flood situation within the next 48 hours in low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River Basin.

title: Three bodies recovered, 17 reported missing after earthslip in Gangoda, Kandy
byline: Three bodies have been recovered while at least 17 individuals are reported missing following an earthslip in Gangoda, Kandy, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: 23 passengers rescued after bus swept away by strong currents in Kumbukkana
byline: The Colombo-Wellawaya main road has been submerged in the Kumbukkana area due to the torrential rainfall affecting the Monaragala area.

title: US suspends immigration requests for Afghans after National Guard shooting
byline: The US has suspended processing all immigration requests from Afghans, after an Afghan man was identified as the suspect in the shooting of two National Guard soldiers near the White House.

title: President issues directives to officials to prioritise public safety and rescue operations
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has issued directives to security forces and relevant officials to prioritise public safety and rescue operations and to ensure the continuous provision of essential relief services, including healthcare for affected populations.

title: President orders to provide Rs. 1 million compensation for disaster victims
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has advised the President’s Fund to provide Rs. 1 million in compensation on behalf of each person who died from disaster situations including flooding and landslides.

title: Emergency Disaster Situation declared for Kandy district
byline: An Emergency Disaster Situation has been declared for the Kandy district.

title: Deduru Oya basin on ‘Red’ alert: Flood warning issued following heavy rainfall
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Irrigation Department for potential major flooding in the lower valley areas of the Deduru Oya Basin, the warning has been issued owing to the significant rainfall continuously received over the upper and middle catchment areas of the Deduru Oya Basin during the past 24 hours.

title: Netflix crashes as ‘Stranger Things 5’ premieres
byline: “Stranger Things” briefly pulled Netflix into the Upside Down.

title: Parliament sittings scheduled for tomorrow and Saturday cancelled
byline: Parliament sittings scheduled for tomorrow and Saturday have been cancelled due to the adverse weather conditions.

title: Several national parks closed until further notice
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation has announced that multiple national parks will be temporarily closed due to the prevailing rainy weather conditions across the island.

title: Toll-free travel allowed on expressways due to disaster situation
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has announced that with immediate effect, no toll will be charged for travel on expressways until further notice.

title: Preschools and early childhood development centers closed from tomorrow
byline: All preschools and early childhood development centers across the country will be closed from tomorrow (28) due to the prevailing adverse weather and associated disaster conditions, the National Secretariat for Early Childhood Development announced.

title: Major flood warning for low-lying areas of Mahaweli River; Amber warning for Kelani River
byline: The Irrigation Department warns that there is a possibility of a major flood situation occurring within the next 24 hours in the low-lying areas adjacent to the Mahaweli River in the Yatinuwara and Gangawata Korale Divisional Secretariat Divisions of the Mahaweli River Basin.

title: All international schools in Sri Lanka directed to close amid bad weather
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Education has advised the administrators of international schools operating in Sri Lanka to temporarily close their schools with immediate effect, due to the prevailing inclement weather conditions.

title: SLAF helicopter rescues 3 flood victims trapped in Mahawa
byline: A Bell 212 helicopter of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has rescued three persons who were trapped on the rooftop of a two-storey building in Mahawa due to floods caused by prevailing inclement weather.

title: At least 65 dead as Hong Kong firefighters battle burning towers for a second day
byline: Firefighters battled a blaze at a high-rise apartment complex in Hong Kong for the second day on Thursday, as the death toll rose to 65 in one of the deadliest blazes in the city’s modern history.

title: Power outages reported in several areas due to bad weather
byline: Power outages have been reported in several areas, including Mahiyanganaya, Ampara and Vavunathivu due to inclement weather-related incidents, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) confirmed.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather climbs to 47 in Sri Lanka, 21 missing
byline: The number of deaths reported thus far owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions across the country over the past couple of days has increased to 47, according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Sri Lanka-bound flights to be diverted to India during weather emergency
byline: The Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation, Anura Karunathilake, has announced that all flights arriving in Sri Lanka will be diverted to Trivandrum or Cochin airports in India if they are unable to land at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) during a weather emergency.

title: Colombo-Badulla night mail trains cancelled
byline: The Department of Railways has cancelled the night mail train operating between Colombo and Badulla, as well as the return service from Badulla to Colombo.

title: Cyclone ‘Ditwah’ forms near Sri Lanka
byline: The Department of Meteorology announced that the deep depression which had formed near the Sri Lankan coast in the Bay of Bengal has intensified into a cyclone a short time ago today (27). The cyclone has been named “Ditwa”.

title: Special holiday declared for govt employees amid adverse weather
byline: A special holiday has been declared for tomorrow (28) for all government employees, except those engaged in essential services, due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Train services on upcountry line limited due to bad weather
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced that train services on the Upcountry Line will be limited to the section between Colombo Fort and Rambukkana until 10:00 a.m. tomorrow (28).

title: Red Alert: Major flood situation in low-lying areas of Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department announced that a major flood situation has already developed in the low-lying areas of the Mahaweli River Basin and strongly advised people living in those areas to evacuate as early as possible.
